column1: 7$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/30/2014 4:37:55 PM$Reviewer: Moe
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"This is the most awful medication on the market that can be used to treat bipolar disorder. It is an 'atypical' which is generally not prescribed for this however my doc wanted to try it since other RX weren't having much effect. The side effects were overwhelming with racing heart rate
column4: muscle aches
column6: drowsiness and dizziness being the worst. One major reason I stopped is because of the potential increase in aggression. I'm a competitive athlete and naturally aggressive and I do not want my aggression to become worse or violent. I've already injured myself prior to taking Fanapt due to my natural 'safe' aggressive behavior and recklessness but I do not want it to become a problem of violence where I could hurt others.

column1: One other side effect that can affect athletes or people who exercise regularly is the abnormal rise in heart rate. My resting heart rate is between 40-50 which is very low. I noticed that my heart races to approximately 120 beats per minute or so just doing simple chores around the house. 120 beats per minute is normally a very vigorous workout for me so this is a crazy situation. Fanapt made exercise and training impossible.
Maybe this medication can help others who are resistant to the side effects however the cons outweigh the pros for me. This RX is a no go for me."

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$5$I experience depression
column4: psychosis
column6: and this really takes the edge off. It hasn't been a cure but has been the only med that really made a difference for me and without horrible side effects. My left hand shakes a little
column8: and it made me a little tired when I first started it but that is gone now. The pluses have been majorly decreased anxiety (less panic attacks)
column10: and better depression. I also lost five pounds on this
column11: which either means that I lost weight I gained on the previous med or Fanapt itself made me lose weight. I LOVE this stuff and it has turned me from a student failing all classes to one getting straight As. Fanapt changed my life!

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $2$2$4$Taking 12mg unable to concentrate

column1: 18$Condition: Schizophrenia$9/8/2012 2:12:40 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$5$I have been taking Fanapt for a week and half.  The side effects at first were horrible; dizziness

column9: congestion) except that my legs keep swelling pretty big.  I'm using Flonase for the congestion
column10: which really helps.  My symptoms are under control but I have a feeling that when I see my psychiatrist they will want me to switch to something else.

35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"I am using a trial pack to see if this med will help with the treatment of bi-polar disorder; and it is probably a little early to tell as far as the ratings go. Day 1 (1mg): I was light headed
column4: my heart pounded out of my chest and I had shortness of breath; I kept having to take frequent deep breaths as though to catch up.  Day 2 (2mg): I experienced all of the above x2
column7: my whole body felt like lead
column10: because my eyes felt like they were swelled or like I could not open them all the way. I was very fatigued my friends said I looked ""flushed."" Day 3 (4mg): I took the morning dosage and felt like I was carrying lead shoes
column11: had a large lead anvil setting on my chest
column12: I literally felt like I was struggling to breathe. I thought I was going to die.  I have tried to drink caffiene throughout this trial..which has helped some
column13: but each day I feel like I am pushing the button.  I am going to contact my dr about the dosage in the am. For the most part
column14: I think I did feel better mentally-more calm and evened-out
column15: if I didn't have the anxiety of thinking I was going to die! It is so frustrating finding the right ""cocktail"" of drugs that suites one's needs. I am keeping my fingers crossed."

54$Condition: Schizophrenia$6/30/2010 1:34:05 PM$Reviewer: Ginny, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking this for almost 3 months now and am now taking 10mg twice daily.My parents say I stopped talking nonsense.I do not hear fake voices as much.The side effect of this is mostly dry mouth and sometimes fatigue.I stopped gaining weight since I stopped the other medicine.I am doing so much better and should be able to go back to school in the fall.
55$Condition: Other$6/21/2010 9:04:22 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am taking this med for symptoms of schizo-affective disorder.  I transitioned off of 45 mg of Zyprexa onto 12 mg of Fanapt per day.  At first I was way over medicated and felt sluggish and out of it for a couple of weeks.  But as I went down on the dosage of Zyprexa (which over 7 years had caused about 100 lbs of weight gain) I felt that my hallucinations and racing thoughts were under control on just the Fanapt.  I like taking the Fanapt as my constant hunger has disappeared.  I have lost over 30 lbs. in the 10 weeks I have been taking Fanapt.  I would highly recommend this medication as a replacement for Zyprexa - all the positive control of Zyprexa without the hunger!
56$Condition: Schizophrenia$6/2/2010 1:50:42 PM$Reviewer: Marie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$This new medicine is helping me cope much better and with less side effects.
57$Condition: Other$5/23/2010 12:03:13 PM$Reviewer: CC, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$I started this drug,about 2 weeks now, I feel slow, sleepy and disoriented, I can not stand to hear the tv, and feel depressed. I have Schizo-affect disorder, which is not full blown Schizophrenia! I would not recommend this drug, for people with my disorder! My parents say my eyes look like I haven't slept for days,and I do hurt family members feelings with things I say while on this drug, my mom tried me on half a pill and I still feel bad, like I can't wake up. I am on 8 mg.pill.  My mom has taken away my meds and wants to see how I do  over the weekend until I can talk to my Doctor. I do not reccommed this Drug at all!
58$Condition: Other$5/6/2010 7:57:20 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$5$The first few days on trial pack  I had nasal congestion and headache. Taking decongestant. The effect this medication has had on my life has been amazing! Previously I was on high doses of two other drugs leaving me apathetic and not caring. Three weeks in and I am off one drug and cut way back on the second and I am alive again! As drugs wore off I have had to really take responsibility for my action in the past, most of which I was unaware of. Side effects and amens aside this drug is well worth taking!

60$Condition: Schizophrenia$4/25/2010 5:27:55 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  (Patient) $1$1$5$Don't take this drug unless you hvae plenty of muscle relaxers and can sit or lay down all day. This medicine has just turned me into according to my family when they see me, it looks like you are drunk. This medicine has totally messed with my sleep cycle in thatI am awake during the night and day time with very little sleep. If your body is sensitive to EPS (extrapyramidal syndrome) then please do not take this drug, it only makes it worse. And as for the whole bit about about being able to think clearer, don't believe it, it just made me more confused and I also feel very slow with my speech and verbal responses.
